channel.title: philstar.com - RSS Headlines
channel.description: Philippine News for the Filipino Global Community

item.title: 20,000 OFWs stranded in Metro Manila
item.author: Jose Rodel Clapano
item.description: Some 20,000 overseas Filipino workers remain stranded in Metro Manila, according to presidential adviser on the peace process Carlito Galvez Jr., chief implementer of the National Task Force against Coronavirus 2019 Response.

item.title: US envoy: Terrorists may use pandemic to strike
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: In a callout for vigilance, US Ambassador Sung Kim has warned that terrorists use global crises such as the COVID-19 pandemic as an opportunity to strike.

item.title: Public told not to threaten Duterte
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: The Presidential Security Group yesterday warned the public against issuing threats against President Duterte or anyone through social media after two persons were nabbed for offering rewards to anyone who would kill the Chief Executive.

item.title: AFP ordered to help in SAP distribution
item.author: Michael Punongbayan
item.description: Defense Secretary Delfin Lorenzana has directed the military to help in the government’s social amelioration program (SAP) for low-income families affected by the crisis spawned by the coronavirus in Metro Manila and other areas.

item.title: Go backs medical scholarship bill
item.description: As the country faces higher demand for healthcare workers due to the coronavirus disease 2019 pandemic, Sen. Bong Go yesterday expressed his support for a bill establishing a Medical Scholarship and Return Service Program for Filipino students who want to serve the country in the field of medicine.

item.title: Duque: Errors only in 1% of DOH data
item.author: Sheila Crisostomo
item.description: The Department of Health confirmed yesterday a report of the University of the Philippines that there were errors in the DOH data on coronavirus disease 2019 in April, but underscored that the mistakes involved less than one percent of the whole data set.

item.title: Government releases MECQ guidelines
item.author: Alexis Romero
item.description: Book stores as well as shops selling clothing, toys and office supplies can reopen, but not barber shops, salons and massage parlors.

item.title: Facebook uses AI to detect COVID misinformation
item.author: Janvic Mateo
item.description: Social media giant Facebook has strengthened the use of artificial intelligence to detect misinformation about the coronavirus disease 2019.

item.title: 137 Pinoys in US die of COVID
item.author: Pia Lee-Brago
item.description: At least 137 Filipinos in the United States, including 18 medical frontliners, have died of the coronavirus disease 2019, the Philippine embassy in Washington reported yesterday.

item.title: IATF reverts 37 provinces to modified GCQ
item.author: Christina Mendez
item.description: The Inter-Agency Task Force on Emerging Infectious Diseases has reverted 37 provinces and 11 cities from “low-risk” areas to modified general community quarantine
